courses.subject: EPBI
courses.title: Protocol Development I

meetings.instructor:
Dr LEE Jock Wai, 
Dr. LAU Chun Hong, 
Miss CHIU Ka Man, 
Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN, 
Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan, 
Professor KIM Jean Hee

Dr LEE Jock Wai, 
Dr. LAU Chun Hong, 
Miss CHIU Ka Man, 
Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN, 
Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan, 
Professor KIM Jean Hee

courses.description: This lecture based course will cover important aspects of the development of a research protocol in public health research including how to identify a meaningful and feasible research topic, how to perform a thorough literature search, ethical considerations, questionnaire design, and sample size estimation.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of this course students will have acquired the knowledge and skills necessary to develop a solid public health research protocol. They will know how to choose a research topic which has practical significance and that they are able to carry out effectively. They will understand the basic principles involved in designing a questionnaire and estimating the sample size which is sufficient to answer their research question. They will also know how to carry out an effective and exhaustive literature search and understand the role of ethical considerations in research studies.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Identifying a Meaningful and Feasible Research Topic

2. Experience Sharing on Identifying Research Topics

3. Conducting Literature Searches

4. Development of a Research Protocol & Example

5. Ethical Considerations in Epidemiological Research

6. Sample Size Planning
courses.feedback_evaluation: To be given by individual lecturers in class
courses.required_readings: To be given by individual lecturers in class
courses.recommended_readings: To be given by individual lecturers in class

courses.subject: EPBI
courses.title: Protocol Development II

meetings.instructor:
Miss CHIU Ka Man, 
Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN, 
Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan, 
Professor TSOI Kam Fai, 
Professor WANG Zixin

Miss CHIU Ka Man, 
Ms. Prisana PAVIVAN, 
Ms. YEUNG Tsz Yan, 
Professor TSOI Kam Fai, 
Professor WANG Zixin

courses.description: This course continues the process of guiding the students in the development of their research protocol through individual discussions between the students and their supervisors and student presentations to their fellow students and supervisors. The presentation groups will be formed consisting of about 6-9 students and 3 supervisors. The supervisors will provide feedback and advice to the students on the development of their protocol.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
courses.learning_outcomes: With the guidance of their supervisor and other supervisors the students will work through the process of the development of their own research protocol. They will learn about the practical application of the principles that they have learned in the Protocol Development I course. Through this process the students will develop an understanding of how to design effective research studies in the real world.
courses.course_syllabus:
Discussion with Supervisor
(by self-appointment)
Discussion with Supervisors
(by self-appointment)
Discussion with Supervisors
(by self-appointment)
Submission of 1st version of Protocol
Protocol Presentation – Group A & B
Protocol Presentation – Group C & D
Discussion with Supervisors
(by self-appointment)
Submission of Final Protocol
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course evaluation will be done at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: Given in Class by lecturers. No required textbooks.
courses.recommended_readings: Given in Class by lecturers. No required textbooks.

courses.description: Students will conduct the fieldwork and collect the required data for the thesis. This will enable them to apply the principles learnt in class into practice to deal with the practical matters regarding data collection. The data collection skills involved include determination of the variables to be measured, design of measurement instruments, validation of the instruments, and conduct of the fieldwork (of measurement). Students also need to present the progress of research.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students will conduct the fieldwork and collect the required data for the thesis. This will enable them to apply the principles learnt in class into practice to deal with the practical matters regarding data collection. The data collection skills involved include determination of the variables to be measured, design of measurement instruments, validation of the instruments, and conduct of the fieldwork (of measurement). Students also need to present the progress of research.
courses.course_syllabus: Writing Observational Study and Diagnostic Study
